result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Perry to 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 4 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is IMPOSED AND STAYED AND THE COURT PLACES THE DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR 8 YEARS.

If revoked conditions of Probation will become conditions of extended supervision

miscConds.notes:
--to pay $4500 child pornography surcharge ($500 per image - 9 counts) 
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--No unsupervised contact with minors
--No access to internet or possess any device capable of accessing the internet except as authorized by Agent
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Complete sex offender treatment as authorized by Agent
--Complete treatment for Asperger's or other Autism spectrum disorders as directed
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--Sex offender registration
--No possession of any type of pornography

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--To serve 1 year in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber/work-release privileges for employment, mental health treatment, including sexual offender treatment, family care & education purposes subject to Sheriff's discretion; to commence 8/18/15 no later than 2:00 pm 

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called at 3:09 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek submits letter from treatment provider; Summary of arguments presented; Statements by Mr. Perry

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Perry to 7 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 4 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years. This sentence is IMPOSED AND STAYED AND THE COURT PLACES THE DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR 8 YEARS WITH CONDITIONS:
--To serve 1 year in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber/work-release privileges for employment, mental health treatment, including sexual offender treatment & family care subject to Sheriff's discretion; to commence 8/18/15 no later than 2:00 pm 
--No unsupervised contact with minors
--No access to internet or possess any device capable of accessing the internet except as authorized by Agent
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Complete sex offender treatment as authorized by Agent
--Complete treatment for Asperger's or other Autism spectrum disorders as directed
--$4500 ($500 per image - 9 counts) 
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--Sex offender registration
--No possession of any type of pornography

If revoked: 
Conditions of Probation will become conditions of extended supervision
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Defendant to report to probation 8/18/15
Recess: 3:57 pm
**Clerk's Note: Off-record: Following hearing Counsel agreed and Court ordered that Huber/Work-release shall also include education purposes**

Case called at 3:37 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for continued sentencing hearing)
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that they are not ready to proceed with sentencing today, presents basis.
Court informs parties that It has openings next week Monday or Tuesday
DA Happ: Not opposed to brief adjhournment
Recess: 3:44 pm

NEXT:  Notices given in Court - Rescheduled Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Article by Dr. Merrick (enclosure that should have been filed with report)

Case called at 10:11 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews off-record discussion regarding attachment to evaluation - neither State or Court received attachment, Atty Svehlek provides
Atty Svehlek submits letter-Marked as Def. Exh#1-offered/received
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Atty Svehlek corrects 2 scrvener's errors in report regarding ages of siblings

William Merrick--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by Atty Svehlek
--cross exam by ADA Hall
--exam by the Court
--redirect exam by Atty Svehlek

Upon testimony of Dr. Merrick, Court indicates that It is inclined to set matter over to explore insurance issue:
ADA Hall: No objection
Atty Svehlek orally motions to bond modification
Court indicates that if there is documentation to support the conclusion that Mr. Perry is going to be able to get treatment at particular location will need to see

Court AMENDS bond to add condition:
--May use internet for limited purpose of applying for health insurance coverage for purposes of sex offender and other related mental health treatment
Recess: 11:05 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Continued Sentencing Hearing/Status Review 8/13/15 at 2:30  - Send notices
Sentencing hearing on July 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
States motion to submit second amended information
With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 11:42am [mo]
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Information Admitted; reading waived
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 of Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Perry  guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court Reads-in and Dismisses: all remaining counts

Attorney Svehlek requests Sentencing be adjourned for six weeks.
The Court and Counsel discuss Pre- Sentence Investigation
The Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation to be completed by DOC within 60 days

The Court directs Ms. Svehlek to schedule a time with the JA.
recess: 11:53am 

NEXT: Atty. Svehlek to contact JA for Sentencing date, mid July((allow 1 1/2 hour))

Case called at 9:36am [mo]
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Svehlek indicates a resolution has not been met and therefore this case will proceed to Trial.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of this Trial.
Atty. Svehlek indicates Mr. Perry is waiving his right to a Jury Trial and indicates a Court Trial would suffice
ADA Hall waives the State's right to a Jury Trial.
Constitutional rights given; The Court accepts Mr. Perry's waiver of Jury Trial; The Court finds this waiver has been knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently.
The Jury Trial dates are to remain on the calendar for next week; which day is used for this case will be determined later today.

The Court addresses procedural matters related to the Jury Trial:
--The Court orders the Witnesses are to be sequestered from the courtroom at the beginning of the hearing; with the exception of the State's courtroom officer 
--The Defendant's Statements will be Admitted during Trial
--The Court and Counsel discuss displaying of the images

On the State's Motion to Allow Introduction And Admission of Other Acts Evidence: 
--The Defense objects; gives arguments
-- Arguments given by ADA Hall 
--The Court grants Motion; give rational
--The Court and Counsel discuss Case Law

On the State's Motion to Amend Information:
--The Defense objects; gives arguments
--The Court and Counsel discuss Case Law
--The Court grants Motion; gives rational 

Attorney Svehlek admits service of Amended Information; reading waived; previous 'not guilty' pleas remain

The Court and Counsel discuss timing of change of plea since it is a Court Trial; Attorney Svehlek is to notify JA of change of plea by noon on 4/30/2015 
recess: 10:20am 

NEXT: The already scheduled Jury Trial dates to be used for Court Trial: 5/4 or 5/5/2015 at 8:30am
Motion hearing on April 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
to Allow Introduction and Admission of Other Acts Evidence (with cover letter)
of Law Regarding the Production of Other Crimes, Wrongs, or Acts of Evidence, State's
of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant (with cover letter)
Jury trial on May 4/5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on April 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 8:37a.m.[MO & MK]
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek summarizes that the aditional discovery she requested, which consists of specific images on disc, is now available. She is making arrangements for her expert to meet with Detective Petig to have her expert view the images.
Counsel agrees that a two-day trial length is needed. 
The Court clarifies to Mr. Perry that the deadline for any change of plea or other case resolution is at the April 20th hearing; after that, the Court intends to proceed to trial.
The Court reminds Mr. Perry that the Bond and its condition continue to be in effect.
recess: 8:44a.m.

NEXT: (1) FSSC on 4/28/15 at 9:00am (2) Jury Trial on 5/4/15 and 5/5/15 at 8:30am

Proposed stip and order for continuance
Status conference on January 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
The Court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form

case called at 8:50am. [MK]
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek indicates there is no resolution to the case. Attorney Svehlek has asked the State for additional discovery materials. During a meeting with ADA Hall last week, ADA Hall learned from the detective that the detective has not received the requested material yet.  Attorney Svehlek asks for continued adjournment and that the Court keep this case when Judicial Rotation occurs.  Attorney Svehlek notes that Mr. Perry has been doing well on bond and she believes they are going to have a resolution of this case. 
The Court declines to retain the case. The Court refers the matter to Branch III for further scheduling. 
Attorney Svehlek requests that this next scheduling be another status because of the new discovery that has not yet been provided.
Mr. Perry indicates that his address remains unchanged.
recess 8:52am.

NEXT:  case is referred to Branch III for scheduling; Defense has requested that a Status Conference be scheduled due to further discovery being awaited
Status conference on December 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

case called at 9:08am. 
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appear for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek indicates that she made request of State for additional discovery; it has not been received yet but she is aware that the assigned detective is pursuing this.  Attorney Svehlek requests the scheduling of another Status in thirty days.
The Court informs the parties that if this case does not conclude on the December 16th date, then by Judicial Rotation this case will be assigned to Branch III/Judge Wambach as of January 1st.
Mr. Perry verifies that the Perry Lane address remains current. 
recess 9:10am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on 12/16/14 at 8:30am.
Motion for Continuance of the 10/28/14 Status: granted
Status conference on November 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 28, 2014 at 09:00 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 9:03am. 
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek indicates that she needs an additional thirty days to continue the investigation of the matter.  Attorney Svehlek requests that the case be scheduled for Status Conference, rather than for trial at this point. 
Mr. Perry indicates that he continues to reside at the Perry Lane address.
Attorney Svehlek orally motions to have computer use at school, for school work only in public areas.  
The Court amends the Bond to add an exception that Mr. Perry is allowed to access the Internet and use a computer at school for school work only; any access or use must be in public areas at the school or in computer laboratories at the school 
recess 9:06am. 

NEXT:  schedule Status Conference at least thirty days out-- in approximately 45 days.
Pre-trial conference on August 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on September 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

After the defendant had signed his amended bond, the minute clerk realized that "for employment searches" was not in the minutes. A corrected bond was done and a phone call was placed to his residence to have him call our office because the corrected bond needs to be endorsed.
This is an Amended Bond, as ordered by the Court on 6/30/14.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:34am.
Defendant William J. Perry in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Perry waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.


The Court addresses the Defendant's Motions to Modify Bond: 
--arguments given by counsel; 
--the Court grants the Motion so that the $5,000 Signature Bond is continued with amended conditions: 
--no access to the Internet from any device except for the purposes of maintaining certification through the American Society of Clinical Pathologist.  To the extent he needs to do that, he must do so from a public Internet access point.  Further exceptions are that Mr. Perry is allowed to access his personal email account one time to obtain the password for his American Society of Clinic Pathologist's account; that access, however must be from a public Internet access point.  Also, he may access the same email address to file and maintain an unemployment claim; and that he may use the Internet from either a public Internet access point or Workforce Development for employment-searches, and that Mr. Perry may use wllsdwn@gmail.com to complete the Kickstarter Campaign; and Mr. Perry may authorize his brother to access his personal email account for the purposes of replying to various questions and emails that may be coming in, and to delete spam-type emails. 
--no unsupervised contact with minors  

Mr. Perry verifies that the Perry Lane address remains current. 
recess 8:41am.

NEXT:  schedule Arraignment within thirty days
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 18, 2014 at 11:20 am.

[Clerk: MK]

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no access to the Internet from any device except for the purposes of maintaining his certification through the American Society of Clinical Pathologist;  to the extent he needs to do that, he must do so from a public Internet access point 
--no unsupervised contact with minors  
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

Mr. Perry verifies that the Perry Lane address remains current. 
recess 1:16pm.
